reviews: I have been using Binance for a little bit, even promoting it on my website. I made a serious purchase a couple months ago of about 2-3 Bitcoin, about $50k, along with my partner who also spent about 50k, so 6 figures total. When the transaction was made, the money was transferred out of our bank accounts, but no Bitcoin was added to the wallet. We waited 3-4 days for the transaction to go through and nothing. We started contacting and found out that our money was sent, but our Bitcoin was being withheld for no reason. There was no reason this should‚Äôve happened since we bought it through the app especially for longer than a week . We were communication with a middle man for months trying to figure out why our Bitcoin was not being sent to us and all we got were excuses saying they were trying their best and that we were being rude. We stopped using Binance on our website and they got upset with us saying that it was unnecessary and that they don‚Äôt understand why we would stop using their services. Been about 6 months and still no word. Our money is long gone and if you use this app to purchase more than a couple hundred dollars worth of tokens, they will take your money as well.
title: If you are a serious investor, you will lose your money.

reviews:
The exchanges GUI is cluttered. I end up touching something I didn‚Äôt mean to touch because all the buttons are close to each other. I understand they want this to be user friendly by placing everything in the open so nothing is hidden but it just makes everything messy. Add menus and you can free up space on the GUI. It‚Äôs hard increasing and decreasing price of coins we are selling in the exchange without hitting something else and causing the screen to swipe. Same goes for the amount buttons to increase and decrease the amount of coins we are selling and buying in the exchange screen. 

Also id like to be able to see market/price history on the buy/sell screen so I can see how much a coin was being sold for last month as I‚Äôm pricing it for selling without having to change screens and go to the other market tab to engage prices. 

Oh and most importantly there should be a note when selling coins that there‚Äôs a bare minimum of .1 before we go to sell our coins. I wasted time setting up a coin to sell just to find out afterwards I didn‚Äôt have enough coins to sell which wasted minutes of my time. So minimums and other rules should be made visible at all times. 

Other than that it‚Äôs a good app. 4 stars.
title: Cluttered GUI

reviews: Why is the Binance app so large tho‚Ä¶over 500mb thats ridiculous to me‚Ä¶future releases should be weigh less
title: App size too large
developerResponse:
{'id': 37703455, 'body': "Hi Zikblak! Thank you for the feedback about the Binance app's size. We understand that the app size may be a concern, especially for users with limited storage space on their devices. Binance aims to provide a comprehensive trading experience by offering various features such as Spot Trading, Margin Trading, Futures Trading, and Staking, among others. These features can increase the app's size due to the required resources, libraries, and graphical elements.

However, we continuously strive to optimize and improve the Binance app with future updates to ensure a smooth and efficient user experience. We appreciate your feedback and will take it into consideration, working towards reducing the app's size without compromising on its functionality.

In the meantime, you can use the Binance mobile website (https://www.binance.com/en) on your smartphone's browser, providing a similar trading experience without requiring the installation of the app.

Feel free to share any additional feedback or suggestions via https://www.binance.com/en/my/user-support/feedback/entry. Your input helps us in our efforts to improve the Binance platform and user experience. 

- FL", 'modified': '2023-07-16T22:23:16Z'}

reviews: Binance stands for everything that blockchain stands against. Why would you attach an email to your wallet? This serves no other purpose than to track and extort. Cryptocurrency payments should be anonymous and I like to keep it that way.
title: BUYER BEWARE
developerResponse: {'id': 33562875, 'body': "Hey there! Let's clear up some confusion. Your e-mail address is not attached to your wallet, it is attached to your account. One of the key defining features of centralized exchanges (CEX) is that they are custodial. Consequently, when you want to trade on a CEX, you keep your funds in a wallet tied to the exchange itself instead of in your own wallet. Not managing your own private keys can significantly reduce the risk of being hacked, as well as offer potentially superior security exposure. ^BB", 'modified': '2022-12-06T09:52:31Z'}

reviews: Small bugs that effect orders, causes small amounts of profit to be lost. Extremely annoying when I want to check bollingers on the graph and I need to sit through a loading screen then when I go back to the trade it‚Äôs already a different price. It‚Äôd be even better if you could buy and sell on the same page as the graph without needing to switch tabs. Fixed 25, 50, 75, 100% buttons to buy and sell seem a little ridiculous considering if I switch tabs I need to re enter the exact amount I want to buy at, by that time the price is already changed. Custom buttons would be nice so we can at least get into the trade within a minute considering the long loading time from the graph. If you‚Äôre holding onto coins for a longer period of time this app is great, if you‚Äôre trying to scalp crypto this apps slow loading times and lack of memory to what you last typed on top of the fees will bleed you dry and assure your quick trades turn into quick losses. If you manage to read the chart quick enough, type in your price quick enough, and get your order filled, you can only hope that it went through the system and actually works because at least 15% of the time you don‚Äôt even have your order queued. From my opinion this app is just here to take your money through fees and is only used because there are no other apps like this on the IOS market as of now. This app will be old news within a year or two. On top of this they are increasing fees on BNB purchases every year until there is a full fee. This app could be the forex of crypto but instead it chooses to be the referral pushing fee grabbing glitchy money taking excuse of the crypto market.

title: Trading

reviews:
I started using this platform the day it began to garner a massive buzz Circa Q216 and within no time it went from being a no-name, irrelevant DEX to the leading global exchange for cryptocurrencies; with more volume 24h than any of its predecessors & has held that title as king largely in part due to the brilliance of their lead dev CZ_Binance, whose humility is that sincerely equivalent to the hallmark of a saint.

Binance is the best exchange for two reasons;

1) while they are a for-profit dex; their charity initiatives such as Binance angels and their interactivity with the community make them bar none number #1 in customer support; additionally CZ will charge a simple fee of $1 to list a new prospective tokens if it meets their criteria for supply & demand amongst the community.

2) perhaps the single most important reason for ‚Äúthe rise of Binance‚Äù and why most traders (including myself) jumped ship from bittrex or whatever other dex at the time for Binance: NOMINAL, LOW FEES! 

‚Ä¢ Their ability to market themselves as the leading exchange with fees that are AFFORDABLE and don‚Äôt cost an arm and a leg for each transaction: especially with the way in which BNB cleverly provides incentives for users to purchase the token to make such fees almost nonexistent.

I think that Binance is without a doubt the best dex and that‚Äôs mainly due to the genuine wholehearted interest of the lead developers to ensure that global integration and not sole individual profit motive is prioritized, therefore  ensuring their success for themselves as a leading global market DEX for years to come.

title: Say no to Binance all over the world
developerResponse:
{'id': 38434717, 'body': "Hello Decent! Thanks for contacting us and checking on this. We can confirm that Binance does not have a partnership or cooperation with this project. This project is also not listed in our exchange platform.

It's important to understand that the world of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology operates in a decentralized and open manner. Blockchain platforms, such as BNB Chain, provide the opportunity for anyone to launch their own projects and coins. This means that various projects can be created and exist independently without any direct involvement or endorsement from Binance.

We strongly urge all of our users to exercise caution and conduct thorough research and due diligence before investing in any project. While we strive to provide a secure and reliable platform, it's also essential for users to take the initiative to research and assess the legitimacy of any project they consider investing in.

If you see any project claiming to be in collaboration with us and is uncertain about the validity of the claim, we encourage you to reach out to our support team directly for more information. reviews:
If you plan on trading crypto and at some point you want to withdraw it as USD, do not use this app. 

Over the last couple of years I invested in ETH, DOGE, and other coins on this app, until recently I was ready to withdraw. I can‚Äôt even view my transaction timeline since they cleared it, but it goes something like this:

7/10/23
Since my withdraw limit was $1000, I attempted to withdraw $1000. Received an email to confirm, clicked confirm. Next day, transaction history says ‚Äúwithdraw expired‚Äù. 

7/11/23
Thought it was just some kind of bug, so I attempted again. Same thing happens. 

7/12/23
Reached out to support, told them the issue, they told me to make sure to confirm the email. I was fairly certain I had already done this, but I did it again and it seemed to work. 

7/13/23
First transaction of $1000 went through. 

7/17/23
Attempted to withdraw $1000 again since I only have until 7/20/23 to withdraw my USD now. 

7/18/23
Withdraw failed. Reached out to support, now they are saying that my account is not eligible to link to a bank account, then support agent Dominique contradicts himself that my bank account is linked to my account but it not with their banking partner. They use Plaid as a middle man to transfer funds securely, like they did on 7/13. How can it be that since just Thursday I was able to withdraw, but now I cannot?

Very untrustworthy. Do not use this app.
title: Do not use this app

reviews:
It is overall an acceptable app with relatively lower fees. But the absolute lack of portfolio tracking is mind-blowing, and some functionalities are disastrous.

- You cannot know you profit and loss, and you cannot even know your initial purchase's value so you can compare it and know if you're at loss or profit. You have to use third-party apps for this supposedly easy feature, and you'll have tons of problems with the synchronization between them. Other apps like Crypto.com have higher fees maybe, but at least I know that my DOGE investment was worth 13 and now it is 183, it is crucial information to hold, buy more or sell.

-you cannot know the minimum of which you can purchase a coin, because they will show you the insufficient funds message first instead. i.e. They are practically forcing you to buy the base coin (loads of it) to then try to buy the other coin with it (with the possibility of have the insufficient amount again and again)!! In other apps (again, like crypto.com) they clearly state that you need xx amount as a minimum if you want to invest in it, easy, right Binance?

Don't get me wrong, it is good on many big stuff, but these little details are as important to many investors and they simply don't care.
title: Acceptable quality app, horrible tracking
